pros: Working for financial reporting, all the financial departments were very integrated and there were very few communication errors. Responsive tech staff, easygoing environment. I enjoyed the regular office parties and socializing culture they had (and it seemed to extend beyond financial reporting as well).
cons: Getting between buildings can be a pain as the campus is rather large. Dealing with individual departments was a pain due to their obscure rules.

review_title: Great place to work if you're a college student
pros: The work environment is excellent. The leadership team is lenient on most things unless you mess up really hard. It is a great place to work if you're a student in the University of North Texas
cons: The calling is can be really tedious and draining if you're not the type of person that likes talking to people. Aside from that everything is good.

pros: Steady hours, flexible with taking days off, helpful coworkers, opportunities for extra hours, easy hiring process, overall positive work environment
cons: Little feedback, pay is not so great, you have to pay for parking or walk which was not so safe for a women when it's dark outside

pros: Super flexible hours, the academic coordinator is outstanding, gain excellent experience dealing with a diverse group of people, reinforce information you learned in the class(es) you tutor
cons: Dealing with the -occasional- bad attitude from one of the students, inadequate parking when there are soccer games (not many cons here!)

pros: Schedule based around class schedule. Tempering Shift switches with other coworkers is easy to do and they are very understanding. Best people you'll work with. Meet a lot of people working at the front desk.
cons: The overnight shifts can be dull. If you aren't used to being really busy or having to multitask all while you are struggling to get a handle on the everyday routine tasks, you may struggle.

pros:
- lots of diversity
- interact with all kinds of interesting people
- never board and you learn lots of administrative skills
- lots of training and development programs
cons:
- lack of leadership-mentoring programs
- low opportunity for professional growth
- many departments are very unorganized and lack efficiency in personnel, operations and logistics

job_title: IT Support Technician in Denton, TX
pros: Management is fantastic! They work around schedules for students and give the opportunity to work on homework and study when there is downtime. I highly recommend working for UNT System in the ITSS department at Discovery Park.
cons: The pay is not fantastic and there is limited opportunity to advance and get raises for both part-time and full-time staff as there is simply not that many jobs here.

review_title: Great opportunity while in school to gain some experience
job_title: IT Student Assistant in Fort Worth, TX
pros: They will work with your student lifestyle very easily. Management takes your classwork as first priority. This allows students to excel while gaining valuable experience
cons:
Low pay. But it is a student job after all. 
Some users are very stubborn about their data.
Some users are not very adept in tech so patience is a must

review_title: The library front desk is rewarding and relaxing if you can handle the constantly changing pace
pros: I've learned beneficial library resource knowledge and made great friends while working at the University's library.
cons: The pace can quickly change from boring to busy. It can be quite stressful when a supervisor is bearing down on you at the same time.

job_title: UNT Dining Services Cashier in Denton, TX
pros: this was particularily an easy job, but after the main chef/manager tore her ACL she was on leave for the second half of the semester that i was working. SO they brought in a temp manager who was cracy
cons: the temp manager was completely disrespecty to all of the workers and to students that came in to eat at the cafe

job_title: Computer Lab Attendant in Denton, TX
pros: Because it's a university student job, they're relatively flexible in terms of scheduling.  Really relaxed during quiet periods like summer semesters.  If you get your job done, you're given flexibility and liberties.
cons: Things can get chaotic during finals.  If there's limited hours in the lab, it can be hard to get work hours. Cliques can form.

pros: In Texas, near Dallas and Ft. Worth.
cons: State funding is inadequate with respect to state demands.

review_title: Culture is excellent, financially it's a bit low.
pros: Granted, each area of the university is different depending on where you work. I work with Student Services and I love my coworkers and my current position.
cons: Very difficult to move up, financial rewards are the pits (i.e., non-existent).

pros: Flexible for student worker, Work as much as I wanted too, allowed off when ever I needed to study for tests. Very relaxed and willing to help assist you with jobs required
cons: Could only work twenty hours a week, Sometimes checks were given out late, had slow days where I sat around and did not really do anything.

pros: Great benefits & paid time off, Light rail train directly to Denton makes it easy to get to Denton
cons: Archaic company culture, ever changing and weak management, profess need to change but no follow through.  For a university, they are technologically very behind. Undermarket compensation.

pros: Location is convenient. There is a bus service. There are lots of restaurants around for lunch. Employers are nice. Work pressure is moderate.
cons: Wage is very poor. There is not enough parking. Schedule management is not the best. Sometimes it is difficult to work around class schedule. No employee benefits or bonuses for working on holidays.

job_title: Student Library Assistant in Denton, TX
pros: You get great customer service experience in an environment than is not demanding. The management were very approachable and pleasant to work under.
cons: Some students come to work on school work some come to goof around and make the workers lives difficult. Dealing with loud, disrespectful patrons was a once a week occurrence. It wasn't fun but it came with the job.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Denton, TX
pros:
Supervisor for introductory biology labs is very nice and helpful
Teaching assignments are a breeze for biology
For the average TA, minimal effort is usually enough (although more is appreciated)
cons:
Students can be very disrespectful
Grading can take a lot of time when research is more important
Very few summer TA positions available for biology

review_title: UBMS Resident Assistant. A program for high school students that teaches and demonstrates work ethic and time management
pros: Great program with amazing staff that dedicate so much time to the program to ensure that students are well accommodated.
cons: Not necessarily a con, but the summer does take a toll on staff that is not mentally prepared for a jam packed summer.

pros: Occasional Comp time hours. is the only good thing.
cons: they do not compensation employees with advanced degrees 2. Raises are non-existent. 3. parking and HR training is awful.

review_title: Website development at University of North Texas
pros: This position had a very flexible work schedule and gave a reasonable amount of time to finish tasks, personal experience, working in teams.
cons: Nothing much as long as you listen to your boss and follow his/her instructions.

pros: Interaction with students, faculty and staff allows you to gain more insight into the institution where you are getting your education. Much of the information you find will prove to be useful in your own education experience.
cons: Many of the staff members are not college educated and may resent the opportunities you have versus their accomplishments.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Denton, TX
pros: Ideal for students because the offices are flexible with your work schedule in order to accommodate students' class schedules
cons: There are some inefficiencies in some of the offices, but I really cannot say much else is negative about UNT. My experience working in two different offices there over the course of 3 years was really great.

pros: I work for the University of North Texas while I was a student. It was a great way to connect with the university and make money
cons: I do feel that most of the jobs that are available to students were underpaid. Most departments have large expendable budgets but still choose to underpay their staff.

review_title: Within the College of Education, student position, the company is great!
pros: relaxed environment, self paced job, wonderful faculty and staff, hardly any drama/politics compared to a corp. environment, pay is good for a student position
cons: sometimes too laid back - might make employees too lax and not want to work hard,

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Denton, TX
pros: Worked as a Graduate Library Assistant (on par with GRA) at the reference desk. The support provided and learning environment are really supportive.
cons: Working with a vast variety of students and members of the public is always a challenge, so it's nothing I would say is a con of UNT itself, but can be difficult nonetheless.

job_title: Student Administrative Assistant in Denton, TX
pros: Great place to work. It's laid back and not too much work most days. It's a great place to work if you want to study and work at the same time.
cons: great just for park time work. not so great if this is your only source of income.

pros: Discount on tuition, access to fitness center, set hours that don't require much overtime
cons: Top down approach that rarely considers the opinions of anyone below management level.  Salaries not competitive.  Very little opportunity to advance within the organization.

pros: Great hourly job to compliment while in school. Working for the university for over two years has been the optimum way to work and excel in school, especially since I could work on homework at my job.
cons: The hourly pay is low, but the benefits of working on homework outweigh the minimum wage received.

review_title: Easy place to work but low pay...
job_title: Administrative Specialist II in Lewisville, TX
pros: Great insurance and tuition benefits. Staff is always nice and decent Lots of fun activities and a gorgeous campus to walk around. Good starter job but not good long-term.
cons: The pay is terrible. 1,200 a month is very low pay, tie barely covers rent in Denton. Not much room for advancement.

pros: Over all managers work around the schedule so its very flexible schedule. Manager lets you have days off for exams. People are very caring and watch out for you.
cons: Limited to 20 hrs. Sometimes work can get slow due to inactivity after the beginning of classes. Sometimes there is drama between adjuncts and professor s

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Denton, TX
pros: Discounted health insurance, flexible hours, exposure to university faculty from different departments
cons: never spoke directly with HR, most TAs were not aware that they were eligible for benefits; work timeline lacked specificity (required to work 10 hours per week from 8/15-1/15, but many of those weeks were outside of teaching periods/while university was closed)

job_title: Student Equipment Manager in Denton, TX
pros: While working there you got to enjoy going on travel trips to other universities while getting to know the staff/athletes. Being on the field during game days of hearing the crowd and weeks of practice that led up to it.
cons: Some of the equipment room wasn't as organized and the hours were very weird

review_title: Okay job for students, nothing to live off of.
pros:
Flexibility with class schedules
Location Convenience
cons:
The pay is so low that to survive, you have to pick up a second job.
If university closures are just "decided on" all of a sudden, you don't get paid for the hours that they took away from you, which kills your budgeting.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Denton, TX
pros: You can get in-state tuition as a teaching assistant. In this way, you can save almost half the cost of your college.
cons: Couse, you are a student, You only can work 20 hours as a part-timer. In the summer or winter break, you can work there as a full-time (40 hours each week).

review_title: Ok if you're not looking for a challenge
pros: Good work-life balance, you get a lot of time off. Also, if you want to obtain more education, you get a great discount if you're a full-time employee.
cons: Pay is really low. Jobs are often time posted to the public, but filled from within. Not much room for growth.

pros: Competitive benefits, awesome staff scholarship, and great Denton culture.
cons: There is a bit of "red tape" and politics and some of the departments are not always pleasant to work for.

review_title: Great place to work and the department is very helpful
job_title: Graduate Teaching Fellow in Denton, TX
pros: Great working environment, leisure environment, good support in the laboratory teaching environment, and the department supports free thinking with the laboratory.
cons: The department has a tight budget which makes it difficult to support all of the ideas for new experiments in the general laboratories.

pros:
Experience in lab techniques 
Flexible hours
Work around exams and classes
Boss is pretty laid back
Music while doing the job
cons:
Coworkers aren't very helpful at times
Multiple tasks at once so writing down a list is necessary
High work expectations for work study
TAs and Students don't follow directions so you're stuck cleaning up after them.

review_title: Lax working environment, decent part time while being a student
pros: Not too stressful and management project responsibilities, especially convenient if you are a current TAMS student or UNT student looking for a part time to balance
cons: Alot of times managers aren't there so you might feel lost/have no instruction or direction on what to do

pros:
100% remote team
Decent health insurance benefits through the State of Texas
Many experience people, willing to work long hours to produce meaningful training
Possibility to unofficially network with wider campus community
cons:
Astonishingly arcane bureaucracy: complex, illogical and unpredictable
Many programs are grant-driven, so people disappear without notice
HR department is vague, distant, untrained and ever-changing (mostly students)

review_title: I'm a student here, so I have a mixed view but the benefits are great for full time workers.
pros: It's a good job while in school and they're understanding of needing time off for school
cons: The pay is not top notch. But I work part time and some people make way more than I do.

review_title: student, teaching assistant, research assistant, instructor
pros: opportunities for advancement exist, my project lead has always been supportive, the atmosphere on the Denton campus is very inviting
cons: figuring out what will happen next is not always easy, benefits are not available for a vast number of employees, the commute is not pleasant

review_title: Fun and exploratory for designers. Sometimes stifling.
pros: They are understanding of students' schedules. There is a also variety of work, from packaging to environmental graphics, to advertisements.
cons: Often an employee about you has final say over creative work, with little to no say.

pros: Hours, flexible location. Employers don't have much requirements and you're open to do pretty much anything. Many times you'll do nothing is there are no students coming in.
cons: Not much interaction with others or employers, low oversight, not much direction on how to tutor students or what to reccommend.

pros: Tuition discounts, accepting culture, tons of cross-training opportunities
cons: Turnover is high, strategy changes too often, under-market pay

review_title: Typical government job that paid their employees in peanuts.
pros: The university worked around my schedule, which was great. My job was also located right next to my classes, which was a plus as well.
cons: Paid minimum wage, and I was the only employee that actually did anything.

pros: pay is ok compared to those hard to get minimum wage jobs. Free food after each four hour shift. Flexible based on out schedule.
cons: Too much work in the dishwashing area. The supervisors were not understanding to bjre more workers - who knows why.

pros: Easy, fun nature able to work easily with other departments. Students are normally very nice to work with. Supervisor has your back and always there for you
cons: You don't get paid near enough. Also getting paid once a month is hard for those that don't know budgeting.

pros: Diverse environment, Good research practices, Helpful faculty and colleagues, challenges existing skills for improvement, overall personal growth is possible
cons: Located in Denton which is a small university town and hence may not be preferable to some. Increasing rent for surrounding apartments making it more expensive for students.

review_title: Best Law School in the Nation!
pros: Nice colleagues, great mission, fabulous students!
cons: It can be hard to start a new law school with our mission.  People outside like to take critical aim.

job_title: IT Senior Project Manager in Denton, TX
pros:
- Teamwork and collaboration are outstanding. I love working with the people there.
- Awesome retirement benefits.
- Retirement benefits can be transferred to another state agency.
- Student focused.
cons:
- COVID has caused job cuts to be made across the board.
- Retirement is hard to attain in this current environment.

review_title: Amazing campus, amazing teachers, and a cheap price tag!
pros: The cost is right, the teachers are seasoned professionals, and it's in a good location.
cons: The campus parking is ridiculous at times, and the campus is too large to walk everyday.

pros: Great intro program for those who want to become a university lecturer
cons: The pay was pretty low, bordering on an internship! $800 per month for 20 hours per week. But they paid full health. Good side job for a student

pros: It has been a great experience to work at UNT we have nice people and friendly environment to work at  Univerisity.
cons: I feel like each department is communicate with each other, you don't know the process progress when you want to get stuff done.

pros: Most of the professors you work with are great, but the fellowship pay is terrible and the benefits are non existent.
cons: The fellowship pay is awful and there are no stipends or other benefits unless you become one of the "favored" students who receive the majority of the grants.

pros: Interesting opportunities plus access to otherwise hard to contact folks. If you want to climb ladders, it's definitely easy to do.
cons: Intra-organization politics are highly polarized, with upper management and employees in some departments being at odds.

pros: A great place for young professionals to jumpstart their career, lots of opportunities to move up.
cons: At the end of the day, UNT operates like a business, not a school. Staff are underpaid, and the President often tries to sell business choices as benefiting students.

job_title: Student & Program Specialist in Denton, TX
pros: Great co-workers (depends on dept.), stable work-environment, and gain experience in working with faculty and students. Pretty good and fair benefits (i.e. vacation/sick leave). University closures mean employees don't have to come in.
cons: Salary can be higher for the stress and time placed on employees (i.e. staff employees).

pros: I loved the professor I worked for. The schedule was so easy to work with and it was easy to manage my coursework with my load as a TA.
cons: None. Loved it.  Please keep up the good work.

review_title: UNT as a good career move?
pros: Good benefits. Easy commute. The stress level may be less than that of a true corporate environment.
cons: Difficult to advance beyond the mid-level.  State salaries are generally lower. Constantly working in a "due more with less" directive.

review_title: Great experience through Housing and Residence life.
pros: The staff. You have to love what you do to be in housing, and these people love it.
cons: unset hours. It's a housing job, so when duty calls, you have to come running.

pros: there really aren't any pros, there was very little positive about this place, UNT continually lowers standards in order to attract more students
cons: expect professors to demand that you provide them with personal services, housesitting and the like, it can be really abusive and the administration just doesn't care

pros: You get to work with student athletes and help them accomplish their goals and see them progress as a student and adult through their college career.
cons: Some of the students are required to be there so they will do everything they can to not work.

pros: Very flexible, can make up own schedule if the one provided for you doesn't fit your life. Hours are evenings which is nice and all in a very close location
cons: Some of the students can be a bit rude, but it isn't anything too bad.

pros: Make your own hours. No more tests or classes. You start to feel like a real researcher
cons: The soul crushing responsibility of finishing your phd. The work gets increasingly isolating as you progress further into your research and fewer people are able to help you.

job_title: Student Assistant in Fort Worth, TX
pros: working part-time depending on the department and you get sufficient time to get other things done, furthermore you gain enough experience
cons: well what i can say is working for unt is different from schooling at unt, thats what i can say.

review_title: Great Benefits and lots of time off
pros: Great Benefits.  Lots of time off.
cons: I worked in an area where there was a lot of drama.  Not all areas are this way.

job_title: Food Service Supervisor in Denton, TX
pros: Very impressive benefits package. Lots of opportunities to accumulate compensated hours to use towards PTO.
cons: Unfocused leadership in some departments. Low food service standards across the board. No opportunities for overtime pay, bonuses, or additional earnings.

pros: Good work and life balance
cons: Colleges and departments don't work together for the benefit of the entire University.  Upper management makes decisions, and then points the finger at others when those decisions, even though right for the Univeristy, aren't popular with faculty and staff.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Denton, TX
pros: UNT seems to be on par with most major universities in terms of science graduate student pay. Decent benefits.
cons: UNT does not always help pay for tuition. Seems to be very professor dependent which student gets scholarships and fellowships.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Denton, TX
pros: I have worked as RA in UNT. Overall, the experience is positive. Because it has given me immense opportunity to learn many new technologies related to web application development using several tools.
cons: High work pressure due to tight deadlines.

pros: Working with great professor, I learn a lot, meet many people, and have opportunities to explorer the new research topics. Free good health insurance.
cons: Salary is not high enough. The work is temporary, so the opportunity would be closed if there is no budget.

review_title: Good work for this part of my life
job_title: Graduate Teaching Fellow in Denton, TX
pros: I have learned lot more from teaching it. I also got a class paid for by the department. Great work for a graduate student.
cons: They cut funding a lot, I had two classes paid for each semester my first year, now it's just one a semester.
